name: Random Access Murder
description: You're a robot. Shoot other robots with your data-destroying weapons and create a stack of dismantled enemies. Be the last heap standing and DO NOT RUN OUT OF MEMORY!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: There's a pop-up 'ad' in the game, with a smug guy with text overlayed that says 'How I made $54 doing this one simple trick'. I imagine this ad is supposed to be satirical however when I saw it for the fourth time after other seizure inducing effects I realized that the ad wasn't actually ironic at all. The smug guy is the developer, happy he managed to sell what can only be called a trainwreck of a game.   Unimaginative level designs, boring weapons, clipping through level geometry, and hit effects that will blind and annoy you with how obnoxious they are. Avoid this dreck.
got this game in a humble bundle. kept falling through walls and dont really feel any purpose or pretty much ever understand whats going on.

Afted spending close to 10 minutes being shot by an invisible enemy, and only seeing him for 1-2 gunfights I stopped. The eye-straining visuals and effects can only last so long before my eyes start to hurt. The game is multiplayer only yet even after being launched through the Humble Monthly Bundle the game has 1 active server. The game isn't fun, strains your eyes and will be dead by next month. Don't waste your money, go buy a candy bar, at least that will have temporary satisfaction.

This game was first made available to Humble Monthly subscribers in August 2016, which drew a lot of people to own the game, however the game is more of a tech demo than an actual game with broken UI and a rather small amount of content, not to mention the seizure inducing effects when being attacked by some weapons left me feeling physically sick and just could not play it anymore. The fact it is multiplayer only does not help it with no one to play with.  The game as a tech demo is a very nice proof of concept but it needs some serious work before it is playable again. For now, you should avoid Random Access Murder.
Baby's first Unity game. Might as well be taken literally.

This game is like Quake Arena, just completely lame, ugly and limited in any possible way.   It's multiplayer only but hardly anyone is playing. Found a server with 2 players.  Had more fun with the Quake Arena-like minigame in Jazzpunk.  Also, this game may give you eye cancer.

I really want to say that this game would be a game to keep an eye on for the full release but this is the freaking full release. There is no objective and this game has the appeal of playing with a friend who hasn't figured out how to play yet. Then it's just nothing. It needs objectives, a timer, something, ANYTHING. It's glitchy, awkward, repetitive and heartbreaking. If this game was getting updated and improved, i would say it's worth keeping an eye on. But yeah only get this game if you got it for free and have 20 minute to kill.
This is the kind of game you gift to your friends to annoy them. Glitches are a part of the gameplay now.  0/10
